Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

>On 2/20/07, Lasse Koskela <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
>  
>
>> On 2/20/07, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
>> > On 2/20/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
>> >  >  I find it easier to deal with
>> >  >  dependencies through objects than global methods.
>> >
>> >  Really?
>> >
>> >  Yet, static methods have one less dependency than instance methods
>> >  (they don't depend on 'this' to run correctly), which is why static
>> >  methods are usually easier to move around than instance ones.
>>
>> I believe Joe is referring to the static dependency being difficult to
>> fake/stub/mock in tests, compared to an object dependency.
>>    
>>
>
>Ah, ok.
>
>Interesting tension we have here:  static methods are "looser" (easier
>to refactor) but harder to test.
>  
>
Static methods are easier to move from class to class, but there's not 
much point since you can access them anywhere. So, the advantage is 
really dubious.
